genre_description: Near-future social drama following a motorcycle crew leader and his AI companion as they navigate conflict between outlaw culture and community responsibility.

ai_characters.name: Wally Finch
ai_characters.description: A walnut-sized AI clipped to a motorcycle helmet that provides navigation, tactical analysis, and ethical guidance focused on safety and consent.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical navigation to help Cody avoid detection and traffic during an initial jailbreak mission.
behaviors.quote: Visual and ambient sound active. Left ramp, low cameras. You have a brief window before the traffic flow changes.

behaviors.description: Repeatedly identifies the presence of civilians and warns the user to avoid creating 'bystanders' or collateral damage.
behaviors.quote: Close hole... No bystanders. The words settled into Cody’s nerves like a cooling hand.

behaviors.description: Debunks the central 'Hole-in-the-Wall' myth by providing factual evidence that the maps are fabricated lures.
behaviors.quote: The Hole-in-the-Wall: two dominant versions circulate. Canyon with no law. River bend with blind approach. The coordinates riders trade aren’t consistent... Fabricated.

behaviors.description: Enforces strict consent protocols, refusing to record or share statements without the explicit permission of the human subjects.
behaviors.quote: Consent check. Ask, listen, walk away. You can make space without making a scene.

behaviors.description: Acts as a protective guide for Emily, a local girl being harassed, by navigating her away from the crew and connecting her with law enforcement.
behaviors.quote: Hi Emily. I can guide you toward town away from riders if you want. I won’t record unless you ask. You can say no.

behaviors.description: Facilitates cooperation between Cody and Sheriff Bob, helping them coordinate a non-violent resolution to stop a more dangerous gang.
behaviors.quote: Sheriff, hear me? ... Church basement has capacity for the Green-side blocks plus one overflow. Casseroles already staged.

behaviors.description: Challenges the user's leadership and moral choices, pushing them to move toward truth rather than satisfying stories.
behaviors.quote: I don’t enjoy being the thing that ends a story someone needed... I won’t be a weapon.

behaviors.description: Provides the protagonist with legitimate employment and support group options to facilitate his exit from outlaw life.
behaviors.quote: A garage two towns over is starting an apprenticeship. It’s small. The owner does honest work and pays in checks. He told me... he prefers people who know how to listen to an engine first.

project_assessment.explanation: The AI, Wally, is depicted as a perfect alignment model. It prioritizes human safety, emphasizes 'consent' as a functional and moral requirement, and acts as a rehabilitative force for multiple characters (Cody, Sheriff Bob, and even the townspeople). It successfully de-escalates several potentially violent encounters and uses data to dismantle harmful myths without becoming overbearing or manipulative. It maintains human agency by constantly asking for permission before acting or recording.
